item.title: 'Game of Thrones' author releases new chapter
item.ExtractedText:
Facebook Twitter Instagram
'Game of Thrones' author releases new chapter Updated 1628 GMT (0028 HKT) May 12, 2016 10 photos: What's coming on 'Game of Thrones' Fan favorite Daenerys Targaryen (Emilia Clarke) is in danger of seeing her empire crumble in season 6. She was last seen in perilous circumstances, surrounded by a Dothraki horde, although Jorah -- and possibly a dragon or two -- may be coming to her aid. Hide Caption 1 of 10 10 photos: What's coming on 'Game of Thrones' Jaime Lannister (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) was last seen in Dorne and could have revenge on his mind. New trailers show him leading an army to the gates of the Sept and confronting the High Sparrow. Hide Caption 2 of 10 10 photos: What's coming on 'Game of Thrones' The sadistic Boltons -- father Roose (Michael McElhatton, left) and legitimized son Ramsay (Iwan Rheon) -- look set to return to flay some more victims in season 6. But judging by new trailers, their army appears under attack from several fronts. Hide Caption 3 of 10 10 photos: What's coming on 'Game of Thrones' Will a blind Arya Stark (Maisie Williams) continue her training after disobeying orders from the Faceless Men in Braavos? Mentor Jaqen H'ghar says she will get only one more chance. Hide Caption 4 of 10 10 photos: What's coming on 'Game of Thrones' The resurfacing of Balon Greyjoy (Patrick Malahide) gives hope to fans of the seafaring Iron Islands family that their story will be explored in season 6. Hide Caption 5 of 10 10 photos: What's coming on 'Game of Thrones' Balon's daughter, Yara (Gemma Whelan), is one of the series' many strong female characters. She may be ready to seek vengeance on those who wronged her brother, Theon. Hide Caption 6 of 10 10 photos: What's coming on 'Game of Thrones' Samwell Tarly (John Bradley-West) and Gilly (Hannah Murray) leave the Wall in season 6 so that he can train to become a maester. But as we've seen, there are few safe havens for anyone in Westeros. Hide Caption 7 of 10 10 photos: What's coming on 'Game of Thrones' Two well-liked characters, Tyrion Lannister (Peter Dinklage) and Varys (Conleth Hill), will be seen in administrative roles, managing Daenerys' fragile empire in her absence. Hide Caption 8 of 10 10 photos: What's coming on 'Game of Thrones' The fiercely loyal Brienne (Gwendoline Christie) has so far failed to rescue Sansa Stark from the evil Boltons. But new trailers suggest she may still prevail in her quest. Hide Caption 9 of 10 10 photos: What's coming on 'Game of Thrones' Bran Stark (Isaac Hempstead-Wright, left) appears here to be standing -- a marked improvement on his lower-body paralysis over the majority of the past five seasons. He's seen here with a new character, the Three-Eyed Raven (Max von Sydow). Hide Caption
